intro: Baccharidastrum argutum var. colombianum, commonly known as the Colombian glassywood, is a shrub or small tree native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its grayish, smooth bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cymes, typically blooming during the dry season. It thrives in dry to moist forest habitats and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
